--- output: html_document editor_options: chunk_output_type: console --- # Unit 1: Overview {.unnumbered} ## Today's Outline - Quick introductions of TAs and me - Syllabus and course outline - General Linear Model framework ----- ## My Research - I am a clinical psychologist with a focus on Substance Use Disorders. - My laboratory focuses on algorithm development for temporally precise psychiatric risk prediction (e.g., moment by moment relapse risk prediction; efficient and early psychiatric screening) and “just-in-time” personalized interventions that adapt to both characteristics of the patient and their moment in time. - To this end, we combine analytic approaches from machine learning with novel, highly informative signals (e.g., geolocation; cellular communications; social media activity; physiology via wearable biosensors) derived by passive personal sensing. - I also teach an introductory course on Applied Machine Learning each spring (Psychohology 752). ----- ## My Personal Life I was born on a small island... ![](./pics/long_island.jpg){width=80%} ::: {.cell} ::: ----- - My family - Melody, Jacob (13 years old) and Hana (10 years old) ![](./pics/sail_family.jpg){width=80%} ----- - My/our passions - Trail running, biking, nordic skiing, all things mountain... ::: {layout-ncol=2} ![](./pics/mtb_john.jpg) ![](./pics/bike_hana_2.jpg) ![](./pics/co_14_3.jpg) ![](./pics/hike_hana_1.jpg) ![](./pics/xc_run_1.jpg) ![](./pics/madnorski.jpg) ::: ----- - My other family..... ![](./pics/lab.jpg) ----- - "John", he/him - Our TAs - Your first name/nickname ----- ## Materials and Assignments ### Materials - [Unit 1 Slide Deck](https://jjcurtin.quarto.pub/01_overview/#/unit-1-overview) - All slide decks on course website ([https://jjcurtin.github.io/book_glm/](https://jjcurtin.github.io/book_glm/)) - And Canvas for application assignments and exams - [syllabus](syllabus.pdf) ### Assignments - [Survey](https://forms.gle/qGH2Cppei3P4ppTP7) (complete ASAP) - Read - Judd et al. Chapter 1, Introduction to Data Analysis - Application assignment (due 9/11 @ 1:30 via Canvas) - [assignment](./_homework/week_01/hw_01) - [data]() - [key]() - Slack DM to John and TAs with Name/Nickname and preferred pronouns ----- ## The General Linear Model **Top level:** General Linear Models **3rd level:** Multiple Regression Models **2nd level:** Simple Regression Models **Bottom level:** Single Mean Models ----- ## Single Mean Models (Bottom level) $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0$ \ **Basic Question** What is the mean of an outcome/dependent variable in a sample? Is that mean different from some specified value? \ **Example** What is the mean IQ of Psych 610 students? Is it different from the average IQ of 100? \ Question: What is this GLM special case analysis often called? ----- Question: What is this GLM special case analysis often called? \ One sample t-test ----- ## Simple Regression Models (2nd level) $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1$ \ **Basic Question** What is the relationship between a predictor variable and a dependent variable? \ **Example** Is trait level of positive emotionality related to satisfaction with a romantic relationship? ----- $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1$ Question: What is the special case analysis when both $X$ and $Y$ are quantitative? ----- $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1$ Question: What is the special case analysis when both $X$ and $Y$ are quantitative? \ Pearson's correlation ----- $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1$ Question: What is the special case analysis when $X$ is a regressor coding for a dichotomous variable representing group membership (e.g., sex)? ----- $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1$ Question: What is the special case analysis when $X$ is a regressor coding for a dichotomous variable representing group membership (e.g., sex)? \ Between groups (independent samples) t-test (or one-way ANOVA with two groups) ----- ## Multiple Regression Models (3rd level) $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ \ **Basic Question** What are the relationships between a linear combination of predictors and a dependent variable? \ **Example** How well do the predictors: (a) number of absences, (b) time spent studying, and (c) interest predict final exam scores? ----- $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special case analysis when $X$s are regressors coding for categorical predictors (e.g., independent variables) representing group membership? ----- $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special case analysis when $X$s are regressors coding for categorical predictors (e.g., independent variables) representing group membership? \ Analysis of Variance (ANOVA) ----- **Basic Question for (one-way) ANOVA** What are the mean differences in the dependent variable between the groups represented by the independent variable(s)? $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ \ **Example** Are there differences among control, placebo and alcohol groups on mean fear response to threat of electric shock? ----- $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special case analysis when $X$s are regressors coding for categorical variables representing group membership, and one or more quantitative *covariates*? ----- $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special case analysis when $X$s are regressors coding for categorical variables representing group membership, and one or more quantitative *covariates*? \ Analysis of Covariance (ANCOVA) ----- **Basic Question for (one-way) ANCOVA** What are the mean differences in the dependent variable between the groups represented by the independent variable(s), holding one or more *covariates* constant? $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ \ **Example** Are there differences among control, placebo and alcohol groups on mean fear response to threat of electric shock, after equating the groups on trait anxiety scores? ----- $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special case analysis when $X$s are regressors coding for categorical and quantitative variables representing group membership, and quantitative scores on individual difference variables, and their interactions? ----- $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special case analysis when $X$s are regressors coding for categorical and quantitative variables representing group membership, and quantitative scores on individual difference variables, and their interactions? \ Aptitude Treatment Interaction (ATI) ----- **Basic Question for ATI** Are the magnitudes of the contrasts among groups different across different levels of some individual difference variable? $\widehat{Y} = \beta_0 + \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ \ **Example** Does the effect of CBT treatment (i.e., contrast of CBT vs. wait list control) on subsequent alcohol related problems differ dependent upon level of intelligence? ----- ## General Linear Models (Top level) $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ \ **Basic Question** What are the relationships between linear combinations of two sets of variables? \ **Example** What are relationships between (a) Personality and temperamental variables, and (b) frequency/quantity of substance use, problems, and motives for use? ----- $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is this GLM special case analysis called when all the regressors for $X$ and $Y$ are quantitative? ----- $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is this GLM special case analysis called when all the regressors for $X$ and $Y$ are quantitative? \ Canonical correlation ----- $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special GLM case when $X$s are regressors coding for categorical variables representing group membership? ----- $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special GLM case when $X$s are regressors coding for categorical variables representing group membership? \ Multivariate Analysis of Variance (MANOVA) ----- **Basic Question for MANOVA** What linear combination of dependent variables ($Y$s) maximally differentiates groups? $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ \ **Example** Do children with ADHD who receive (a) medication, (b) parent behavioral training, or (c) both, differ in indices of academic and behavioral functioning? ----- $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special GLM case when $X$s are regressors coding for categorical and quantitative variables representing group membership and quantitative *covariates*? ----- $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special GLM case when $X$s are regressors coding for categorical and quantitative variables representing group membership and quantitative *covariates*? \ Multivariate Analysis of Covariance (MANCOVA) ----- **Basic Question for MANCOVA** What linear combination of dependent variables ($Y$s) maximally differentiates groups, holding constant one or more covariates? $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ \ **Example** Do children with ADHD who receive (a) medication, (b) parent behavioral training, or (c) both, differ in indices of academic and behavioral functioning, when equated for parental expectations? ----- $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special GLM case when $X$s are regressors coding for quantitative variables and $Y$s are categorical variables representing group membership? ----- $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special GLM case when $X$s are regressors coding for quantitative variables and $Y$s are categorical variables representing group membership? \ Discriminant Analysis ----- **Basic Question for Discriminant Analysis** What linear combination of independent variables ($X$s) maximally differentiates groups (represented categorically by $Y$s)? \ **Example** What combination of sociocultural, personality, and intellectual variables best differentiates repeat juvenile offenders and non-repeat juvenile offenders upon completion of boot-camp? ----- $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special GLM case when $X$s are regressors coding for categorical variables representing group membership and $Y$s are repeated measures of a quantitative variable? ----- $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ Question: What is the special GLM case when $X$s are regressors coding for categorical variables representing group membership and $Y$s are repeated measures of a quantitative variable? \ Repeated measures ANOVA ----- **Basic Question** What are the mean differences across $Y$s, overall or between the groups represented by the independent variables ($X$s)? $\beta_{Y1}*Y_1 + \beta_{Y2}*Y_2 + \beta_{Y3}*Y_3 = \beta_1*X_1 + \beta_2*X_2 + \beta_3*X_3$ \ **Example** Does affective response differ when viewing pleasant, neutral vs. unpleasant slides? Does this slide type effect differ among participants in two beverage groups (alcohol vs. no-alcohol)? ----- ## Survey of GLM Landscape with One Y - 610 only adddresses GLMs with a single Y ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}

````` ::: ::: - 710 handles multiple Ys in the context of repeated measures analyses - Multivariate statistics courses address other contexts with multiple Ys ----- ## Final, Mind-blowing Wrinkles - The top-level General Linear Model is itself a special case of an even more general statistical model - the **Generalized Linear Model** - which allows for models with dependent measures (errors really) from different distributions and non-linear link functions connecting $X$s and $Y$s. - The General Linear Model can also be thought of as a special case of Structural Equation Modeling. - All of the variables that we have described so far are single-indicator, observed variables (i.e., individual constructs of interest are measured using a single task or measure). - Each of the statistics we have described have a multiple-indicator, latent variable analog. They are special cases of these latent models in which there is only one indicator per individual construct.
